title: Estadio Ganzábal
text:
Estadio Ganzábal is a <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> <a href="stadium">stadium</a> in <a href="La%20Felguera">La Felguera</a>, <a href="Langreo">Langreo</a>, and is the <a href="Home%20%28sports%29">home</a> of <a href="UP%20Langreo">UP Langreo</a>.
History.
The history of the stadium starts in the 1920s, when it was called as "Estadio La Barraca", with <a href="CP%20La%20Felguera">CP La Felguera</a> playing its home games at the stadium, before merging with <a href="Racing%20de%20Sama">Racing de Sama</a> for creating the <a href="UP%20Langreo">UP Langreo</a>.
In 1961, year of the merge, the stadium was renamed as "Estadio Ganzábal" as homage to Francisco Fernández Ganzábal, local engineer and president of the club.
In 2006 the stadium was completely renovated. The under-19 teams of <a href="Spain%20national%20under-19%20football%20team">Spain</a> and <a href="Turkey%20national%20under-19%20football%20team">Turkey</a> re-inaugurated the stadium with a friendly game on 20 September 2006. The first game of the local team in the new Ganzábal was played on 3 September 2006. Langreo defeated <a href="CD%20San%20Mart%C3%ADn">San Martín</a> by 2–1.
League attendances.
This is a list of league and playoffs games attendances of <a href="UP%20Langreo">UP Langreo</a> at Ganzábal.
